data: It has sometimes occurred to me that the great suits of armor we see in museums, the huge helmets that come down like extinguishers on the penny candles of modern humanity, the enormous cuirasses and gigantic iron gloves, were neither more nor less than downright and deliberate cheats practised by the “Gents” of those days for the especial humbugging of us, their remote posterity.
Sir Jasper Carew: His Life and Experience
browsing: literature|browsing: fiction|category: adventure|category: novels|category: british literature
